website_summaries.verdict: This stick does a good job on new and old stains, and has an agitator on the applicator.
pros: Can be applied directly to the stain and rubbed in with the applicator
Works on blood and tough grease stains
Gets a lot of stains out effectively

customer_reviews.title: Bleaches clothes
customer_reviews.text: Ruined my expensive clothes. This stuff effectively bleaches colored fabrics. What junk, took a small stain and destroyed $100 outfit. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Strong perfume smell, stain removing capabilities are not that great for our clothes.
customer_reviews.text: The price is better than the other stain remover that I buy, but this doesn't work as well. This one leaves a lot of stains in the clothes. We do get a lot of food grease stains on our clothes and this doesn't really work for that. Perhaps this works for grass stains? Also I can't stand the perfume smell of this product. Even if I just treat one small spot on one article, it will make the whole load of laundry stink. The smell also stays in the washing machine and will make the next load have a scent (even if I don't stain treat anything).
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: Not "magical" but does help with some stains
customer_reviews.text: This product was meant to get some clothing items sitting with set stains back into my closet. Unlike the amazing reviews of others, I got mixed results. What it worked on: Fading a tea stain in a polyester cream top (1 overnight sit) Removing a mystery grey stain in a white/blue striped dress (2 overnight sits) What it failed on: Removing or fading car grease/gunk stain on a white cotton shirt (2 overnight sits) Removing coffee drop stains in white shirt (2 overnight sits)--this came out immediately with a peroxide/baking soda soak
customer_reviews.author: Whitney F.

customer_reviews.title: pretreat your shirts with this before wash, it works well.
customer_reviews.text: works as expected - great buy. removes yellow pit stains and collar dirt and oils my dry cleaner doesnt pre-treat shirts if you wash and press only if you give in for dry cleaning. at the cost difference its worth it for me to take 5 minutes for 2 weeks worth of shirts and do this myself. 1 bottle lasts for probably 80 shirts at my rate of use. i treat collar and arm pits it seems to remove everything.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the two pack of this on sale to try it, and I’m very glad I did. The cleaning product comes out of the bottle easily, and there are little notches to help you rub it into the material. I have a five-year-old who manages to come home with everything imaginable on her clothing and so far this stuff gets an A+. Highly recommend. It has worked on all types of fabric from sweaters to nice dresses without ruining the fabric color or texture. We have also used it to get a juice stain out of her teddy bear with great success.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Webb

customer_reviews.title: Works on some things. Strong smell.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well on many stains but not the miracle worker that the review by Americas Test Kitchen led me to believe. Will not remove set-in grease/oil. Also, smell drive me nuts. So perfumery that even after two extra rinses, all the clothes in that load still reek of it. I will not buy again for that simple reason as strong odors bother me.
customer_reviews.author: KatclimberTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works on all stains
customer_reviews.text: I'm a nurse, my husband works construction and we have 3 active kids. Between us all our clothes end up with a variety of messes from body fluids to grease, grass, and art projects. Spot treating is the only way to prevent permanent stains. I've used several in the past but this one is my favorite. Not only does this remove the stains, it's also easy to use. No messes, built in scrubber, no overspray. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Not effective on grease stains
customer_reviews.text: I checked reviews for stain removers before purchase, looking for the best ones. This came up as one and I can't figure out why because it is ineffective for grease stains. That's what it was purchased for- treating grease stains. Even when used days before laundering, it doesn't work. Don't cook in nice clothing if this product is the only one you have available for stain removal. I'm returning it and hope this review saves someone else from buying it for grease/oil on (cotton) clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Don't Care Bear

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!! Bleaches clothes!!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware!!!! Bleached my kids’ expensive sweatshirts. I’m so upset. I very rarely have the money to buy such expensive things for my twins. This stain stick has completely ruined them.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolette

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. They designed the head of the container to release waaay too much of the product so you will be wasteful and use too much. Just mix some dish soap, peroxide and baking soda for just as good results if not better and use a dedicated brush for applying. Plus this stuff stinks like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: BriaMar

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a stain remover for shirts that had been washed and dried with oil based stains. Many online remedies include making potions and multiple steps. Phew!! Who has time for that?!?! I found oxiClean Max Force and It got a two year old oils based stain out of my North Face ski jacket insert. (For older stains I let product sit for several days.). and everything in between, sold! Now is being used for baby blowouts and spit up stains with great success. And it doesn’t have that nose burning chemical smell that some other stain removers do. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Where has this product been all my life?!
customer_reviews.text: As someone who works with horses in terrible Houston, TX summer heat, I get a lot of stains on my clothes. Horse slobber, horse medicine and medicated shampoos, blood, manure, human and horse sweat, Gatorade/Powerade stains...you name it. This is the only product I've ever found to get out the majority of all kinds of stains! It works best if you're able to apply the gel right after you stain your clothes, but that isn't always possible when you're working outdoors. Despite that, it still does a pretty remarkable job removing older stains, too! Combine w. OxiClean washing machine powder, and it's a potent match for any stain!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: This product Works..
customer_reviews.text: I could not believe how great this works.. it took out OLD grease stains on one of my favorite shirts.it was stained for a while and I just did not want to toss it out.. so I ordered this and WA~LA it worked. .. I used it on other stuff and wow stains gone.. I like this and it's so easy to use. I will be buy more and telling many friends about this.. thank you for a great product..
customer_reviews.author: Larrie D Pretzer

customer_reviews.title: Ruins clothes. Removes dye.
customer_reviews.text: I’m sad to report this, but it ruined two of my favorite pieces of clothing. It removed the dye in the areas where I put the stain remover. It looks like weird faded spots. Worked fine a light pair of jeans and tshirt but my navy blue top and super cool pants are ruined.
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: Its says 2-pack, but you will only receive ONE!
customer_reviews.text: Good product. However, the item description states 2-pack, but you will only receive one of these. Becomes very overpriced. Received only one in my subscribe and save. Rep on chat offered to send me a new "2-pack". Of course, I only received a single unit again (but I was made whole). Best part of it is the little white sticker on the plastic baggie it arrived in said "2-pack" as well. Obviously mis-stocked. Glad I was paying attention.
customer_reviews.author: randomman

customer_reviews.title: good cleaner but scent over whelming
customer_reviews.text: I gave this cleaner 4 stars mainly because of my personal preference. The cleaner does a good job, but don't expect it to remove old tea or coffee stains. It has a VERY strong fragrance and blue color. It is not for me. I buy detergents free of dyes and perfumes. I don't usually worry about spot removers since you use such a small quantity. You can put this on one or two items and the whole load will come out smelling like this product. If you are sensitive to dyes and perfumes or just prefer not to have them, this probably is not the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Vcp420

customer_reviews.title: Great Product BUT Read Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Works great but read the instructions on the bottle. Had ring around the collar on white and colored work dress shirts which I could never remove with anything else. I read the instructions which mention you may have to leave the initial OxiClean on for a full week before washing. Well I tried that and it did remove the ring around the collar on all of my work shirts and any other stained items.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Saved my clothes from ink stains
customer_reviews.text: Monday I washed mine and my husbands laundry to open the dryer and surprise I found a pen that exploded all over my clean and dried clothes. I ordered oxy clean and the max force stain remover stick and pretreated the stain then washed the load again today with a whole scoop of oxy clean and a cap of gain with warm water and the pretreat option for wine on my washer and almost all of the ink is out of the clothes thank god. The only thing that still seemed to have some ink were some under clothes. So if you ever have a pen explosion in your dryer this is the stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Dad of 2

customer_reviews.title: Leaves a strong residual fragrance
customer_reviews.text: The product worked well when used as indicated to remove stains on a pillowcase and shirt in a mixed laundry load, but left behind a strong floral fragrance in everything that came out of the washer despite having an extra rinse added . After two dryer cycles, there was still a pungent fragrance . I would not recommend this product to anyone who has an aversion to strongly scented products that do not wash out under usual washer/dryer conditions .
customer_reviews.author: George H.

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly efficient stain remover
customer_reviews.text: This is the best stain remover I have used. It has worked on all kinds of stains, most notably, I injured and bleed a lot on my carpet and using this stain remover the carpet looks like new. The smell is not my favorite but for me key is it’s efficacy. Also, it’s very easy to apply. I’d definitely recommend it to anyone that looks for efficient stain remover
customer_reviews.author: Dejan Markovkj

customer_reviews.title: Overpowering, lingering scent - nothing like regular OxyClean
customer_reviews.text: I am sensitive to scents. I use regular OxyClean and have no problem with it. These sticks on the other hand are awful. The scent is utterly overpowering and lingering. Multiple trips through the washer, using vinegar in the rinse water. Nothing gets this awful scent out. Stick with soaking items using regular OxyClean which works way better anyhow. Not impressed at all - doesn't work and that awful scent would ensure I never bought it again even if it did work. I'd give zero stars if that were possible.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Gets out anything
customer_reviews.text: I discovered this product at our daughter's house when my husband asked me to try again to get a years-old stain out of a favorite t-shirt. I sighed and gave it a go. Having tried everything else I was just going through the motions, but when it came out of the wash, the stain was gone. An entire glass of red wine on a white damask tablecloth? No problem? Ballpoint pen? Blood? Spaghetti sauce? All gone. The gel is thick enough to stay where you put it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: About to order more!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and the scrubbing nodules really make a difference when pre-treating stains. Used it last night to get chocolate milk and ketchup out of my son's striped shirt. Felt like a commercial, but it's true! Does leave a fairly strong fresh scent behind. I'm about to order more, I got hooked on treating stains, which are definitely happening more frequently now that my kids are spending more time outside, doing crafts, eating while I try to work, etc.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Ruins the colored clothes
customer_reviews.text: It’s good for the whites but leaves worse stain on colors. I followed the directions and used it for a white sweatshirt and a shirt -see the photo. Stain on the white garment is gone and I’m happy for it but I’m very upset that it ruined the pretty expensive shirt. I washed it just with detergent afterwards but stain because of gel didn’t go away. If you are going to use it for white clothing then buy this product but look for something else for the colors.
customer_reviews.author: N.B.

customer_reviews.title: A Real Miracle!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried spot removers most of my 53 years on this planet and have NEVER been able to find one that gets clothes dye run out of clothes until now. My daughter had spent her hard earned money on a LuLu Lemon exercise top (not cheap) that was a very light blush color and then accidentally washed AND DRIED a piece of clothing with it that was very dark maroon resulting in many dye runs onto the new top. All my life, I've ended up throwing the affected clothing away because I've never been able to get it out. I bought this with hopes, because I never give up hope. BUT IT WORKED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It's a REAL MIRACLE!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey I

customer_reviews.title: works great on gross kid stains
customer_reviews.text: I have two girls - 3 and 1 - so trust that this stain stick gets a lot of use. I have even had luck with set stains that had already gone through the washer/dryer. I have been using Oxi Clean products for years and this is now my recommended stain product when my friends ask how I keep my girls' clothing clean.
customer_reviews.author: J. Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Greatest product for stains I've ever used, and I have used them all.
customer_reviews.text: This will remove most or all of a stain that has been washed and dried. Sometimes, I have to treat it two or three times, but it never lets met down. My husband stains his shirts often and doesn't usually fails to tell me so I can treat it right away. By the time I get to them, they are usually completely dried and sometimes I don't see them and they go into the wash and dry cycles before I catch them. This is a great product to use for any type of stain. I also use the liquid OxyClean in my washer to boost the all around cleaning power of my detergent.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrie Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Highly disappointed with this product. I trusted it would work based on the powder version which is much more effective in stain removal if you soak first. Also had a strong overpowering smell and blue coloring that I felt were unnecessary and annoying.
customer_reviews.author: The P-Unit

customer_reviews.title: Did the job but perfume overwhelming!
customer_reviews.text: This did get the stains out. The deal-breaker for me was the heavy perfume. Do not use this on clothing you will continue to wear unless you (and everyone around you) enjoys breathing in a cloud of overwhelming scent. It only partly washed out, too. Also, the applicator is too wide for most situations -- a narrower one would be be more convenient. Please, please manufacturers -- stop putting perfume in cleaning products. It is at best annoying and at worse a health or allergy problem.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: this stuff works
customer_reviews.text: I liked that this came as a two pack for what I would have paid for one in the store. I love this stuff. While there are times that you may need to treat and wash more than once, its always worked for me. If there was one thing I don't like is that since the gel is thick sometimes it squirts off the surface you are treating. I would recommend laying the material on a hard surface and then using this.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy412

customer_reviews.title: Strong Scent. Reasonably Effective but Not Terrific.
customer_reviews.text: Even a small amount used on stains then run through the wash leaves clothes with a very strong scent. The scent is pleasant but it is pretty intense. Makes me wonder what is in there and if the fragrance potency is healthy. Works okay but not on my toughest baby stains unless soaked for a day or 2 and run through multiple times in the wash. You also have to push down to get the liquid out and too much dispenses; it is wasteful. Like the Oxi brand but wish this was more effective on all my stains and more mild detergents/ scent.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: GIVE IT A HARD STAIN
customer_reviews.text: Tried this on a sweater that had some oily food spill on it, the oil stained the item forever......so i thought. After thinking the sweater was a total loss I threw some of this on the sweater that at this time had been sitting in baking car for weeks. Let the product set onto the stain for 24 hours then tossed in the wash. When the item was done and dried the oily stain that was there for weeks was totally gone! Soon as I seen that, I ordered two more bottles of this stuff! IT WORKS THAT GOOD!!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Works on old and new stains! Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've tried numerous stain removers in different forms and this one has been the best hands down. The numbs allow you to scrub and if it's a fresh stain you can see it working. It's worked wonders on set in stains as well and I really like that it can be treated and left more than 12 hours until I have a load without damaging the clothes. I never cared personally for the laundry powder but do highly recommend anyone trying this.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great for kid related stains!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing. When my son was born oxi clean became my best friend. Poop stains? (Even really old ones on hand me downs!) Gone! Breastmilk & spit up stains? (Seriously why is that stuff SO hard to get out?!) Gone! Tomato? Grass? Grease? All gone. This stuff is truly incredible. Highly recommend especially to anyone caring for a small child.
customer_reviews.author: amandaf

customer_reviews.title: Works for almost all stains!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these Gel Sticks. It's very convenient and we use it to clean the stuff the kids gets on their clothes. The only thing that it didn't take off completely was dried blood (after a very bloody nosebleed) - actually you can't see the blood, but at certain angles, you can kind of see where the blood used to be. I used it on my kid's clothing and wash it on cold most of the time, almost all of the stains comes out on one wash. Love it and use it all the time unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: DocReviewer

customer_reviews.title: I did not like the head of the product and the way the case is designed
customer_reviews.text: First you use a lot of product if you use it as per the instructions. I found a better way to use it: 1. Place the case normally 2. Push the top and product will come out of case 3. With a toothbrush take some product 4. Apply and brush If you use it as per the instructions is hard to use, you use a lot of product and is not that effective
customer_reviews.author: Erick M.

customer_reviews.title: Works Wonders
customer_reviews.text: Have been using product for several years and I start to panic when I cannot find product at various stores. So, knowing that I can order it from Amazon will take the worry away. Talk about getting out stains, there is no other product I've tried that works as well as this. I like the idea of pressing it down on fabric, rolling the cleaner on the stain, washing it as normal, hanging garment to dry and finding that "presto" the stain is gone. So easy to use. No ruined clothing. Way to go OxiClean!
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Baseball Mom Must!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 kids and this is the best thing I've found to work on hard core stains. From baby food, to grass, to mud, to wine...nothing works better! Scrub the gel in then toss it in the wash like normal. Obviously for things like baseball pants, try and rinse them off as best you can first (pressure washers work wonders) then use this to get the really soaked in stains out. Wouldn't make it through baseball, football, etc without it!
customer_reviews.author: airman ashley

customer_reviews.title: Best stain remover EVER
customer_reviews.text: All you need to know: this gets newborn baby poop out of clothing, even WHITE clothing! Let's face it, newborns blow out their diapers. A lot. This stick has saved us from just throwing our baby's outfits in the trash every time! Just rinse the item, then apply this gel before washing, and it will come out completely! It even works on dried or previously washed stains! I will be buying these by the dozen for the next few years!
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: The scent is super strong
customer_reviews.text: It works well as a stain remover, but the scent is sooooo strong that it give me a headache. Is king of easy to use, but hard to get just a bit out for a tiny stain, I feel that sometimes I’m wasting product. The dispenser cannot be recycled, so that is an issue for me too.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Ehh... the pretreatment worded great for getting stains out my dogs bed. It has a weird smell when I pretreated stains & let sit overnight. It did help get stains out of there as well. The only downside is your get a few uses out of this depending on how many clothes you are pretreating. I wish it was more of a squirt bottle because it doesn’t seem like there’s really much in the bottles. I’m not sure if I would purchase again as I’m going to be making a homemade stain remover . If anything - I’ll just have these as backups
customer_reviews.author: Simone Alicia

customer_reviews.title: This works easy as a pretreat for difficult stains
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I share the jobs and she cooks great so I do the laundry. Laundry can be time consuming so I like products that are easy to use and just work. This takes out most stains even when I use it just before putting it in the washer. It also works well if I use it right away and leave it sit in a laundry basket for a few days before washing.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard on holiday

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awesome
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome for stains on clothing even if the stain doesn’t get caught until it is being loaded into the washer. I try to pre-treat stains before clothing is put in the hamper, but that doesn’t always happen. The bonus is that this also cleans the cast burners on my stove better than anything else. I cook a lot and my stovetop gets a workout so the burners were looking old and dirty. Not any more.
customer_reviews.author: TXk

customer_reviews.title: A life-saver for tough stains!
customer_reviews.text: So I actually bought this to use on a mysterious stain on our carpet. Truly, we have no idea where it came from--it smelled like paint thinner and make the carpet fibers very dark and stiff, but no evidence was ever found. The dog never confessed. I used an entire stick for the job (comes in 2-pack) and it took a bit of elbow grease, but this stuff made the stain COMPLETELY disappear. So happy! I have the other stick in our laundry room for clothes stains and plan on ordering this right away should we ever have another bad stain on our upholstered furniture or carpet again.
customer_reviews.author: McKC

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective on stubborn stains
customer_reviews.text: I used it take out really stubborn stains of tea spills. I have also tried to clean things like old sweat marks and general "yellowish" tinge of clothes. It went away - all of it. Be warned, sometimes it needs to be kept longer as the instruction says. For stubborn stains, I leave them applied overnight before I put in the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mandal

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without this
customer_reviews.text: I am super lazy. When I get a stain on my shirt I put some of this on the stain, then wad up my shirt and toss it in the hamper. I dont rub it or rinse or anything. Then wash that clothing item with my regular wash. The stains always come completely out and I am not sure why but even if this sits on my shirt for days it does not damage the fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen McCrea

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try
customer_reviews.text: Really quite awesome - removed set in grease stains without altering the color of the shirt dye. It did not get out all stains but I saved probably 7 out of 9 shirts (the husband has a habit of wearing his good shirts no matter what he is doing or working on). Its worth a try...I have not tried them on food stains.
customer_reviews.author: Mojo

customer_reviews.title: God send!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE!! Haven’t come across a stain it won’t remove. I used this for everyone’s clothes. Husband is in the animal control field, I’m a mom(let’s face it we get dirty), two dirty dudes 11.5 and 16 months. I do wish you got more product for the price but it’s a fantastic product. I go through 5-7 a month.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia DeSio

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love this product
customer_reviews.text: I was always a fan of the Spray and Wash Stain Stick (and I still bring that when I travel as a pre-treatment when I can't do laundry ) but this product works MUCH better on removing stains and can be used ahead of time or just as your tossing the stained item in the wash. Only once did it fail to get all of a blood stain out. Other than that it has been a godsend in saving my clothes! Very easy to use and a tube lasts quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Readerlee

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Got this in the hope that it would work even better than the same product in spray form, but with this stick it just squirts a massive amount of gel out, sometimes in multiple directions so that it gets everywhere (and I'll use it up just as fast as the spray bottle, which went quickly!) Didn't seem to work better than the spray, or even maybe a little worse. Smell is fine, and it did lighten most stains.
customer_reviews.author: psychstudent5555

customer_reviews.title: Top notch stain remover.
customer_reviews.text: There is no comparison to this product. I did some painting in the house and saw the next morning that I got it on my pants. I used some of the product and a spoon to scrape off the paint, and with some elbow grease it came right off. It is way better than any competitors product and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: robert1725

customer_reviews.title: EVEN OLD STAINS DISSAPEARED
customer_reviews.text: SINCE I BECAME A SENIOR, I FIND I AM CONSTANTLY SPILLING STUFF ON MY TOPS, AND WAS LOOKING FOR SOMETHING TO 'SPOT THE SPOTS' AND REMOVE THEM REGARDLESS WHAT TYPE OF SPOT IT WAS - AND SO FAR HAVE FOUND IT IN OXY CLEANS GEL SPOT REMOVER - SPOTS THAT THIEIR LIQUID SPRAY LEFT. NOW I'M USEING BOTH.
customer_reviews.author: Pat C.

customer_reviews.title: Handy and compact
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend. Very handy, takes up very little space compared to spray bottles. Also easy to dispense all the way to empty (unlike spray bottles). Not a ton of product in the stick, but the price reflects that and I'm okay with it. Dries reasonably quickly so if you are pretreating your clothing but aren't washing right away, it can go into your laundry hamper and not get all over your other hamper clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Juju

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This works so well on pretty much all stains I have applied this to. I don't need to use any other stain remover. For tough stains I have applied and let it sit overnight and the stain washed out easily in the wash. I have kids, pets, and a husband who seems to spill everything on his shirts. So you can imagine all the stains I have had to use this for.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of 2 girls

customer_reviews.title: Amazing - even washes out month-old blood stains!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is absolutely amazing. I use it mainly for food and blood stains on cottons. All I do is scrub it in and let it soak. I can usually see some results almost immediately. For recent stains, it's either immediate or I let it sit a couple hours before throwing it in the wash. I've also used it for older stains - let soak for a night or two - and it still gets it out!
customer_reviews.author: LY

customer_reviews.title: Gets 95% of my stains out. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: These have been great! I love that I can put this on a stain and leave it for a couple of days. That way if I do forget about it I don't come back to a ruined shirt like other spray on stain removers. Not only that but it seems get get out about 95% of my stains. If you put it on the stain within 5 hours of it happening then it's like 99% sure to come out. At least that's been my experience. I will definitely buy these again once I start running out.
customer_reviews.author: Beirsty

customer_reviews.title: You've seen the late night advertisements
customer_reviews.text: I use this to get out oil, coolent and work related stains. Works on about 70% of then. Way-oil and rapid tap are pretty aversive oils.
customer_reviews.author: happy peeps

customer_reviews.title: Good bye stains!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works amazing!! I’ve gotten month old spaghetti stains out of my sons shirts. I’ve gotten random stains out of my girls clothes thar have been there since spring! I will say it has a decent strong smell that did stay after the wash but it is a clean smell so I’m not worried about that. I would recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: ONLY STAIN REMOVER TO BUY
customer_reviews.text: I'm the worlds world's biggest critic when it comes to stain removers. I was never overly impressed with Shout or Spray and Wash.THIS PRODUCT ACTUALLY WORKS. Gets out OLD stains,grease, jello,chocolate.. and used it on my carpeted car mats! I just reordered another two bottles and another gel!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Mcfarland

customer_reviews.title: max forced my collar rings into oblivion
customer_reviews.text: i use this especially for ring-around-the-collar on shirts and spot stains elsewhere on clothing. i do not even have to wait to wash. i apply and then immediately start the cycle (it may vary for others, and may depend on detergent used in the wash). the textured application pad on top helps gently scrub the product onto fabrics without being rough. it doesn't bleach any colors, so it seems to be safe enough to use wherever you want to.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try and get old stains out of my 2 year olds clothes. Worked on 2/3 outfits. I followed instructions and washed in hot water. I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnsay

customer_reviews.title: Removes every stain & brightens whites
customer_reviews.text: Friend recommended this and it works every time. Has a scent but it’s pleasant enough. Gets everything out: ink, raspberries, candy stains, dirt, food, etc. I love this stuff & it’s priced better on Amazon than in the stores where you can’t even find it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Acierno

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, non-messy, easy to use stain remover
customer_reviews.text: This product has removed stains that have long been on clothing. I have tried several at-home remedies for stains and other stain products (similar to this) and this is the only one that has been able to remove the stains on my little ones' clothing. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: domend

customer_reviews.title: Toddlerhood: Brought to you by OxiClean
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is seriously incredible. Blood stains, food stains (beets, barbeque, blueberries, and more), medicine, paint, grass stains, caked on food, mud, poop stains - you name it, it's successfully tackled all. We probably go through about a stick a month pretreating my son's laundry with no intention of stopping. For super duper stains, just pretreat, wash, and dry in direct sunlight and poof! Stain is gone. Highly recommended for all baby and little kid-generated stains. :)
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Saved a lot of baby clothes
customer_reviews.text: Works really well on baby formula stained clothes and now that my kids a toddler it still works great on food and dirt stains. I put it directly on the stain and give it a little rub and leave it overnight and wash it the next day. The stain comes right off. Dont leave it on too long unless the fabric is white. I had some blue shirts become discolored because I didn't get to the laundry the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamcasher

customer_reviews.title: Best stain remover ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are simply the best! You can honestly get these just about anywhere, however, the delivery for these is almost always overnight, and the packing is simple and easy to open (or non-existent). I cannot recommend this product, from this source, enough! Buy immediately!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great. I have used it for a long time and now have to leave a review. My husband and were at dinner and I spilled a full glass of red wine on a pair of white jeans. By the time we got home the wine was dry. I pulled out the Oxi-Clean gel and went to work on the jeans. It took a while because they were covered. My husband was incredulous I was even trying but what did I have to lose? They came out spotless. There was a residual odor of the gel but it comes out in the next wash. Try this stuff. You will not be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK ON STAIN -- ADDS MORE STAINING!
customer_reviews.text: The gel stick didn't remove the stains; it set them and ADDED MORE FROM THE PRODUCT ITSELF! Followed directions and repeated again with same AWFUL result. Wound up buying iron-on stickers to cover the stains on what garments could be fixed that way (3). Had to throw the remaining two away. What a mess--tossed the gel stick away. gbg
customer_reviews.author: gbg

customer_reviews.title: The only one that works for me.
customer_reviews.text: I usually use the spray for and it doesn’t really matter to me how it’s dispensed but this is the only formula of anything that works on my stains.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey Meeker

customer_reviews.title: Slightly bleach my clothes
customer_reviews.text: You can't leave this stuff on for long, it slightly bleached my clothes so now the "stain" is lighter than the surrounding, which ruins my clothes. I wish I could give it zero stars. I am going to stick to Shout Stain Remover that has always worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ann L.

customer_reviews.title: Gets rid of tough stains!
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth stick! This gets rid of the toughest stains. I originally got it for my newborn and accidents and now I use it for all our clothes. I recommend using this as soon as you spot a stain and throwing it in the bin. You can leave the cleaner on clothes for up to 72 hours although I have done it as long as 5 days. The only negative that might be a positive for some people is the strong smell.
customer_reviews.author: J.u.Bee

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelmed. Spray much better
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy again. OxiClean Spray is far better: gets stains better out on dark backgrounds; you use a lot less and it covers stains much better. Plus, you don't lose the blinking cap--the sticks have a cap, which is forever somehow in the way. And if you lose the cap, the stick seems to evaporate quite quickly. Skip the stick; go with the OxiClean spray.
customer_reviews.author: Movin' southTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great stain remover
customer_reviews.text: The product itself works great, really removes tough stains. What I don't like is the application -- I can't seem to apply it without it getting on my hands, and it takes ages to wash it off my skin, and my fingertips are left raw and dry. This is obviously just me, but it makes me less inclined to repurchase something like this, and I'm going to start looking for alternatives that don't feel so...chemically.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie R

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Glob it on stains, and let it sit. The longer, the better. Seriously, a week is not too long. Then wash it in the warmest water the garment can stand, and it almost always takes out the entire stain. If it didn't work, catch it before it goes in the dryer, and repeat the process.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Stavlund

customer_reviews.title: Removes virtually any stain
customer_reviews.text: This is only my personal opinion, but I am a big fan of OxiClean products and this one is my favorite. For me personally, it removes virtually any stain in cold water. This includes blood, fruit juice, balsamic vinegar and fats. It is easy to use and does not require for me to get messy.
customer_reviews.author: Svetlana Piner

customer_reviews.title: Best so far
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a lot of different products in this category but this one has been the best so far
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: FIERCE ON STAINS!
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Spray -N-Wash stain stick with Oxiclean, however I can no longer find the combination stick. I found this and love it! Oxiclean Max Force Gel Stick is fierce on removing stains. The only thing is that it took me a while to learn to control the amount of product coming out of the container when applying it.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet-Rain

customer_reviews.title: I like tide sticks and some spray removers more
customer_reviews.text: Tide sticks are so much better. This product is messy and doesn’t remove stains (at least not not on my kids clothes). Tide sticks are more effective in my experience, but they are very small. I really like folex spray stain remover for upholstery.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t get full shipment
customer_reviews.text: I have a subscribe and save of THREE units. This means 6 total sticks. My monthly shipment this month i only recieved 3 single sticks. So i am Missing three but was charged the full amount. I order Every month and this is the first time this has happened.
customer_reviews.author: melissabrose

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: Easy to get those collar stains out. May have to apply twice if stain is pretty bad but otherwise, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because my toddler spills everything he touches on my dining room chairs. It worked great. I put it any stain I saw, even the old ones, and this cleaned the chairs very well. A lot of the previous stains that I wasn't able to get out before came right up. I massaged it into the chairs and left it on for about 1 1/2 days and used my shampooer to get everything up.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: Life changing.
customer_reviews.text: I had a sweatshirt that I loved but was about to throw out because I had tried everything to get this stain out (not even sure what it was) and had just been in my closet for a year or so. Tried bleach, vinegar/baking soda/hydrogen peroxide, everything. ONE TREATMENT WITH OXICLEAN AND IT WAS GONE. Miracle. It says not to use it on wool, but I'm going to try a little bit because I have a wool sweater with a stain too.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! I have a infant and a 7 year old who are constantly getting stains on their cloths and the oxy stain stick is so easy to use. And it works!!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Groesse

customer_reviews.title: OxiClean Stain Remover
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful stain remover! This was my first time using this product and I'm so glad that I tried it. It really works to remove tough stains and dried on stains. This helps to make laundry day easier. I would recommend to anyone whose tried other brands and weren't satisfied. This is works!
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Gets the stains out.
customer_reviews.text: My wife has to contend with a 6 year old, and me. Both of us are fairly messy. So far this stick has saved some of my favorite t-shirts, and my daughters clothes as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Cooley

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this so much but can't
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of use & the smell. But it bleached/stained the color out of all of my hubs' stretchy undershirts. They all have way bigger "deodorant" looking stains than before. It removed all the smell, though. So.... it did that at least. X20 $$$ undershirts ruined. :(
customer_reviews.author: Steve + Gabri

customer_reviews.title: No more scrubbing!
customer_reviews.text: My husband drops food on himself all the time which ends up leaving stains. This Oxi clean max force is amazing, it has taken oil stains out of shirts and pants. Its so very easy to use and best part is i don't have to scrub it! Just apply it on the stain and leave it on for few minutes and then throw it in the washer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works like magic!
customer_reviews.text: I love this OxiClean! I use it on every tough stain. It keeps all of my white towels perfectly white with every wash. A word of caution: I left this product on an off-white fabric for over one week in hopes to get rid of a deep stain, and I wasn't able to get out the blue coloring of the OxiClean gel. It was my own fault for not heeding the product advice of "up to one week."
customer_reviews.author: leileik

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Oxi clean for a while now. It works on most stains as long as you apply it right away and wash it in a few hours or a day without damaging the fabric. Fast and good service by seller. I will purchase again from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to stain remover. Always works, doesnt harm my clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Amazing-will keep buying them forever
customer_reviews.text: My uniforms are dark and had white stains under the arms because of anti-perspirant and sweat. Nothing worked. This stuff did. Two years before I found something that did. If you’ve got stained clothes you need to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Why do I even...

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work on mattress stains
customer_reviews.text: i bought this because, i accidentally spilled ramen on my mattress, awhile back and tried to clean it with wet vacuum which made my entire top of mattress dirty. tried almost everything to clean it wasn't helpful, i tried this in my mattress didn't help only left a thick scent in it which makes my nostrils suffer everytime i sleep. I haven't tried it on clothes but it works amazing on pet carpet stains and food carptet stains
customer_reviews.author: Sravya gudapati

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stain removal and nice, long-lasting smell
customer_reviews.text: Did an amazing job on chocolate stains, set-in blood stains, and persistent armpit stains. Be forewarned: the smell is very strong. It's a very nice smell, but it lasts for a very long time and will make the rest of your load of laundry smell like it too, so be prepared for that.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Stain Remover
customer_reviews.text: One of these lasts FOREVER, so two is almost overkill, but I love this for removing all kinds of stains. I guess I spill red wine a lot, because I have first hand knowledge this gets wine out of scarves, sweaters, and shirts. I also use it on the armpits of dresses and shirts and they come out of the wash like new. The gel stick is super convenient to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: Blair

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Stain Remover!
customer_reviews.text: So far, best stain remover I’ve found! This is the best value I’ve found too. Normally in store I would pay more for just 1 tube, here I get 2 for less than I’d pay for 1! I have found that the tube does run out pretty quickly though.
customer_reviews.author: Caseypagez

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: This is my all time favorite stain remover. I have it on hand at all times. When you allow the soiled item sit with the remover it works magic.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product and good price!
customer_reviews.text: The product works great. It even got out a couple of old stains. I wish I had taken a couple of befire and after pictures. With my Prime subscription I don't have to worry about running out!
customer_reviews.author: Gammie

customer_reviews.title: Great on grease stains and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great on grease stains. Old and new. Clears any other surface stains easily
customer_reviews.author: Andie

customer_reviews.title: The best stain remover
customer_reviews.text: I can't live without this stuff having a little guy
customer_reviews.author: Tary

customer_reviews.title: The gold standard
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the best I've used for stain removal. Ink on you pants? Gone. Red wine on your white carpet? Gone. Saved my keister a bunch of times. Though beware the scent is strong so you need to fully rinse/wash it out. Easy for a pair of pants, harder for a carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

product_meta.title: OxiClean Max Force Gel Stain Remover Stick, 6.2 Oz, Pack of 2
product_meta.description: Don't get stuck with stains - OxiClean Max Force Gel Stick lets you treat stains now and wash later. The ultra-concentrated gel formula stays where you put it and the special stain-grabbing nubs work the formula deep in to clothing fibers to help break apart stains. This gel does it all: lifts food stains from fabric; dissolves and traps grease and oil; binds to dirt and soils to suspend and rinse them away; targets protein stains like grass and blood; and helps break down food thickeners such as those found in ice cream. Formulated with 5 powerful stain fighters to fight the toughest stains. After treating your garment, you can wash it up to one week later. The formula rinses clean away. Includes one 6.2 oz. bottle of OxiClean Max Force Gel Stick. OxiClean offers a wide array of products to fit all your stain removal needs. The OxiClean family has grown to include stain removers, pretreaters, laundry detergent, and much more!
feature_bullets: Two 6.2 oz. bottle of OxiClean Max Force Gel Stick
Lets you treat stains now and wash up to one week later
Ultra-concentrated gel formula stays where its applied
Special stain-grabbing nubs work the formula deep in to clothing fibers
Works on all types of stains: food, grease, oil, dirt, grass, blood, ice cream, etc.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
